title: The Swedish rival to Tesla's Semi scores a deal with PepsiCo to deliver snacks in the UK
description: Electric vehicle firm Einride will supply two of its trucks to PepsiCo to transport Walkers chips in central England.

title: Why India is so important to Apple
description: India is a massive market with an expanding middle class to power sales growth, and potentially a home base for the production of millions of Apple devices.

title: Fox News and Dominion settle election defamation lawsuit for $787.5 million
description: The settlement between Fox Corp. and Dominion Voting Systems came as opening arguments in a Delaware court were delayed for hours amid speculation about talks.

title: Google to launch its first foldable phone, the 'Pixel Fold,' in June
description: The phone will be the company's highest-priced smartphone.

title: United Airlines posts net loss but forecasts profit for second quarter
description: United reported a loss for the first three months of the year but forecast a profit for the second quarter, when the peak summer travel season picks up.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to meet with India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi following Mumbai store opening
description: Apple CEO Tim Cook will be meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as the iPhone maker looks to expand in India.

title: Germany has shut down its last three nuclear power plants, and some climate scientists are aghast
description: Germany shut down its last three operating nuclear power plants on April 15, despite a last minute plea from some prestigious scientists.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon depositions set in Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking lawsuits
description: Sex  criminal Jeffrey Epstein, whose former friends included Donald Trump, Bill Clinton and Prince Andrew, was a JPMorgan Chase client from 1998 through 2013.

title: China's economy is on the rebound — and that's good news for 3 of the Club's consumer stocks
description: Robust consumer spending helped China's economy grow by the fastest rate in a year last quarter — a development we've long been preparing for.

title: Fed Governor Bowman casts doubt on the need for a U.S. digital dollar
description: A CBDC could intrude on the privacy of users and harm banks while providing few benefits otherwise, Bowman said in a speech.

title: Goldman Sachs is watching for 'cannibalization' from Apple's new savings account
description: Goldman Sachs is Apple's primary banking partner for its iPhone financial services.

title: Boeing CEO stands by plans to increase 737 Max production despite recent flaw
description: Boeing disclosed a flaw with some of its 737 Max planes last week and said it was likely to delay deliveries.

title: Some electric vehicles from BMW, Nissan, Hyundai and Volkswagen will no longer get federal tax credits
description: Revised tax incentives for electric vehicles are part of the Inflation Reduction Act, the landmark climate law that President Joe Biden signed in August.

title: McDonald's is tweaking the recipes for its most iconic burgers, including the Big Mac and McDouble
description: The fast food giant says it has made "small but tasty improvements" to the Big Mac, McDouble, cheeseburger, double cheeseburger and hamburger.

title: Fed's Bostic sees one more quarter-point rate hike, then a hold 'for quite some time'
description: Atlanta Fed chief thinks the FOMC can watch and wait as the lags that come with monetary policy work their way through the economy.

title: Netflix reports earnings after the bell — here's what to expect
description: Netflix reports first-quarter earnings after the bell on Tuesday, as investors await updates about its new ad-supported tier and password-sharing crackdown.

title: Southwest Airlines briefly pauses departures after reporting technical problems
description: More than 1,500 flights, or 36% of Southwest's schedule, were delayed, according to flight-tracking site FlightAware.

title: Coinbase CEO says the crypto exchange is preparing to go to court with the U.S. SEC
description: Brian Armstrong, CEO of Coinbase, told CNBC that it is "going to have to actually end up going to court" with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Bank of America posts first-quarter results that top expectations on higher rates
description: Bank of America reported first-quarter earnings and revenue that topped expectations before the bell Tuesday.

title: UAE, Qatar set to restore diplomatic ties and reopen embassies after bitter feud
description: The apparent push toward greater diplomatic normalization comes amid broader regional reconciliation efforts.

title: Elon Musk plans 'TruthGPT' A.I. to rival OpenAI, DeepMind
description: Tesla, SpaceX and Twitter CEO Elon Musk called for regulation of AI during a taped interview that aired Monday on Fox News Channel's Tucker Carlson Tonight.

title: Norway’s giant sovereign wealth fund says there’s money to be saved by identifying ‘rotten apples’
description: Norway's gigantic sovereign wealth fund believes it is becoming increasingly important to identify as many "rotten apples" as it can.

title: Power firm SSE says backing renewables can help get Britain closer to energy self-reliance
description: The CEO of British power firm SSE says a rapid build-out of renewable projects can help the U.K. to secure its energy security.

title: The EU's divided approach on China might be coming to an end — and the U.S. is unlikely to be happy about it
description: European Union officials on Tuesday called for a new and joint approach toward China, in a move that is unlikely to please the United States.

title: Treasury yields little changed as focus remains on economic outlook, earnings
description: U.S. Treasury yields were little changed on Tuesday, as investors continued to assess the outlook for the U.S. economy and digested the latest round of corporate earnings.

title: Britain could see crypto-specific regulation in the next 12 months, top lawmaker says
description: The British government laid out plans in February to regulate cryptoassets and opened its suggestions up for consultation.

title: Apple opens its first store in India as it looks for a new generation of iPhone users
description: Apple CEO Tim Cook has long held a bullish view on India and now the company is ramping up sales and manufacturing of its flagship iPhone in the country.

title: Goldman Sachs is set to report first-quarter earnings — here’s what the Street expects
description: So far this earnings season, big banks have mostly outperformed their smaller peers, helped by an influx of deposits after Silicon Valley Bank's meltdown.

title: Lululemon used tiny organisms instead of fossil fuels to make the nylon for its new shirt
description: On Tuesday, Lululemon announced it's selling shirts made with nylon sourced by way of biomanufacturing processes from biotech company Geno.

title: Nio says it won't join the 'price war' and slash prices like Tesla
description: Chinese electric car company Nio will keep its prices high rather than cutting them, CEO William Li told CNBC in an interview.

title: China's economy grew 4.5% in the first quarter, the fastest pace in a year
description: China's growth has been under the spotlight as it reopens after ending most of its strict Covid restrictions that were in place for nearly three years.

title: You've probably had the Sunday scaries. To beat them, consider 'bare minimum Mondays'
description: "Critics are forgetting that the bare minimum quite literally means that it's still enough," says Marisa Jo, who coined the term on TikTok.

title: These Asia-Pacific central banks have paused rates for now. Who could be first to cut?
description: The Bank of Korea was the first to hold rates steady after being one of the first nations to hike in the pandemic era — and could become the first to cut rates in the region.
